meanings.definition: To run faster or farther than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: During the race, Sarah tried to outrun her friend to the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah can easily outrun any other animal in the wild.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, hoping to outrun him this time.
meanings.sent4: In the marathon of life, sometimes determination can outrun natural talent.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to whisper to the leaves, urging them to outrun the storm.

meanings.definition: To surpass in speed or achievement.
meanings.sent1: With hard work and dedication, she was able to outrun her own expectations.
meanings.sent2: The student's grades continued to outrun those of his classmates.
meanings.sent3: The little engine that could managed to outrun the doubts of the other trains.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity always seemed to outrun any negativity around her.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays tried to outrun the approaching clouds, painting the sky with vibrant colors.
